hints: The famous line 'you like jazz?' is from this movie
This animated film features a bee who sues the human race
Jerry Seinfeld voices the main character in this 2007 movie
This sci-fi film features a blue-skinned alien race called the Na'vi
Directed by James Cameron, it was the highest-grossing film of all time
The story is set on the fictional moon of Pandora
This superhero film features a billionaire genius who builds a powered suit of armor
Robert Downey Jr. stars as the titular character
This movie kicked off the Marvel Cinematic Universe in 2008
This animated Disney film tells the story of a young lion who becomes king
It features songs like 'Circle of Life' and 'Hakuna Matata'
The main character is named Simba
This Christopher Nolan film is known for its mind-bending plot about dream infiltration
Leonardo DiCaprio stars as a professional thief who steals information by entering people's dreams
The movie is famous for its ambiguous ending involving a spinning top
This 1939 classic features a young girl from Kansas transported to a magical land
The main character famously says, 'Toto, I've a feeling we're not in Kansas anymore'
It includes iconic characters like the Scarecrow, Tin Man, and Cowardly Lion
This 1993 Steven Spielberg film brought dinosaurs back to life through groundbreaking CGI
It's based on a Michael Crichton novel about a wildlife park of cloned dinosaurs
The T-Rex attack scene is one of the most famous sequences in the movie
This 1994 crime film by Quentin Tarantino features interconnected stories of Los Angeles criminals
It stars John Travolta, Samuel L. Jackson, and Uma Thurman
The movie is famous for its non-linear storytelling and iconic dance scene
This 1980s classic features a teenager who accidentally time travels in a DeLorean
Michael J. Fox stars as Marty McFly
The movie coined the phrase '1.21 gigawatts!'
This iconic horror film is about a boy who can communicate with spirits
It features the famous line 'I see dead people'
M. Night Shyamalan directed this 1999 supernatural thriller
This animated Pixar film is about a rat who dreams of becoming a chef in Paris
The main character, Remy, controls a human by pulling his hair
It features the catchphrase 'Anyone can cook'
This sci-fi action film starring Keanu Reeves questions the nature of reality
The main character is offered a choice between a red pill and a blue pill
It features the famous 'bullet time' special effect
This 1975 Steven Spielberg thriller is about a giant man-eating shark
It's famous for its suspenseful music composed by John Williams
The police chief says, 'You're gonna need a bigger boat'
This 1964 musical stars Julie Andrews as a magical nanny
It features the song 'Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious'
The main character uses her umbrella to fly
This 2008 Pixar film is about the last robot on Earth cleaning up garbage
The main character collects interesting items he finds while working
It features minimal dialogue, with the robot mainly saying his own name
